member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LockType
member.summary: Node lock types.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LockType.Modify
member.summary:
An InputAccel "C" or change lock.
Prevents:
Delete locks on the nodes immediate children.
Modify lock, Delete lock, and task processing on the node.
Delete locks and task processing on the node's ancestors.
Allows:
Moving or adding child nodes.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LockType.Delete
member.summary:
An InputAccel "D" or delete lock.
Prevents:
Modify locks, Delete locks, and task processing on the node and its children.
Delete locks and task processing on the node's ancestors including its immediate parent.
Prevents a Modify lock on the node's immediate parent.
Allows:
Deletion of the node and/or its children.

member.summary: Scope of an InputAccel Server setting. Specified as a parameter when writing out server settings.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ServerSettingScope.Current
member.summary: In-memory InputAccel Server setting.
member.remarks: Setting applied to the current running instance of the InputAccel Server.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ServerSettingScope.Persistent
member.summary: Persistent setting that is applied when the InputAccel Server starts.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ServerSettingScope.CurrentPersistent
member.summary: Setting applied to the current running instance of the InputAccel Server. This setting is also saved as a persistent setting.
member.remarks: This is valid only when applying a value to an InputAccel Server setting. Invalid for getting a setting value.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ServerSettingScope.Default
member.summary: The default value for the setting of the InputAccel Server.
member.remarks: Only valid when getting the default value for a setting. Invalid for applying a setting value.

This enumeration is used as a parameter to method.
The ServerMessageFlagsSetMask parameter tells the InputAccel Server which flag(s) to change. This parameter enables you to selectively set/clear specific flag(s) without changing the values of the other flags.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.CacheOperations
member.summary: Values to control which types of operation are cached.
member.remarks: These values control whether caching operation affect all GetProperty operations, all SetProperty operations, or perform with their default behaviors. For example, when used with the property, the GetProperty value causes all GetProperty operations to be disabled from caching; that is, the operations are routed directly to the InputAccel Server, bypassing the cache.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.CacheOperations.None
member.summary: The default value.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.CacheOperations.GetProperty
member.summary: "Get" property calls.
member.remarks: For example, this value can be set on to bypass the cache and retrieve IBatchProcess.Name directly from the InputAccel Server.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.CacheOperations.SetProperty
member.summary: "Set" property calls.
member.remarks: For example, this value can be set on to bypass the cache and send IBatchProcess.Name directly to the InputAccel Server.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ClientOptions
member.summary: Options used during the construction of the client to control high level client behavior.
member.remarks: Currently, ClientOptions is used to control behavior when the client attempts to perform an operation with an InputAccel Server that is disconnected.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ClientOptions.None
member.summary: No special behavior. For example, an exception of type is thrown if is called when the InputAccel Server is disconnected.

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ClientOptions.DisconnectedException
member.summary: Top level disconnect exception is thrown instead of an API specific exception. This allows for easier handling of a disconnected InputAccel Server. For example, an exception of type is thrown if is called when the InputAccel Server is disconnected.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation
member.summary: Used to activate and query the activation status of the InputAccel Server.
member.remarks: The process of activating the InputAccel Server involves importing the activation (CAF) file and presenting the InputAccel Server ID and profile ID to the user. The server ID and profile ID are required to retrieve the InputAccel Server activation key from the EMC|Captiva activation portal. This key is then used to activate the InputAccel Server.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.Activate(System.String)
member.summary: Activates a dongleless InputAccel Server.
member.param: The activation key is provided by the EMC|Captiva activation portal: http://activation.captivasoftware.com/
member.remarks: The activation key accepted by the InputAccel Server consists of alpha characters. It does not include '-'s

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.Import(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Imports a Captiva Activation File (CAF) to the InputAccel Server.
member.param: Captiva Activation File
member.remarks: Import is supported only when connected to one InputAccel Server, otherwise an exception is thrown if connected to a ScaleServer group.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.FileStatus
member.summary: Current state of the Captiva Activation File (CAF) on the InputAccel Server.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.GracePeriod
member.summary: Date when the activation grace period of the InputAccel Server expires.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.ProfileId
member.summary: Gets the activation profile ID. The profile ID and the server ID are used to validate the InputAccel Server against the activation code.
member.remarks: The profile ID is available after a valid activation file has been imported.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.ServerId
member.summary: Gets the activation server ID. This becomes the ID of the InputAccel Server.
member.remarks: This is available after a valid activation file has been imported.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IActivation.Status
member.summary: Returns the current activation state of the InputAccel Server.

member.summary: An exception class to wrap IACLNT32 errors
member.remarks: The ancestor for this class, ClientException, is declared in IAClientExceptions.cs. This is because there is no externally-visible class to represent IAClnt32, but we do need to expose Clnt32Exception since our code throws exceptions of that type. The other exception class files all match up to a specific class, but this one does not; the best place for it is with the general client exceptions.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LicenseExpiredEventArgs
member.summary: Represents the argument passed in the event.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LicenseExpiredEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason for this event being fired.
member.remarks:
The reason could be one of the following.
"The InputAccel Server license activation grace period has expired. To activate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The InputAccel Activation file change grace period has expired. To restore activation, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The InputAccel Server environment modification grace period has expired. To restore activation, either reconfigure your hardware back to its previous configuration and restart InputAccel Server or reactivate the product. To activate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The grace period has expired. Either the InputAccel Server environment changed significantly since the last time you activated the product or you are using a node of an MSCS Cluster that was not activated. To restore activation, either reconfigure your hardware back to its previous configuration and restart InputAccel Server, or reactivate the product. To reactivate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
Note that the reason could be in a non-English language if the operating system is running in a non-English language supported by EMC.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LicenseGraceEventArgs
member.summary: Represents the argument passed in the event.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.LicenseGraceEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason for this event being fired.
member.remarks:
The reason could be one of the following:
"The InputAccel Server has detected that you have installed an Activation file but have not activated it. The server is now fully operational in a grace period that will expire in %d days, %d hours, %d minutes. To activate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The InputAccel Server has detected that you have installed a new Activation file since the last time you activated the product but have not reactivated it. The server is now fully operational in a grace period that will expire in %d days, %d hours, %d minutes. To reactivate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The InputAccel Server environment has changed significantly since the last time you activated the product. The server is now fully operational in a grace period that will expire in %d days, %d hours, %d minutes. To resolve this, reconfigure your server hardware back to its previous configuration and restart InputAccel Server or reactivate the product. To reactivate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
"The InputAccel Server environment has changed significantly since the last time you activated the product or you are using a node of an MSCS Cluster that was not activated. The server is now fully operational in a grace period that will expire in %d days, %d hours, %d minutes. To resolve this, reconfigure your server hardware back to its previous configuration and restart InputAccel Server or activate the product on this cluster node. To activate now, refer to the InputAccel Administration Guide."
Note the reason could be in a non-English language when the operating system is running in a non-English language supported by EMC.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ICache.Commit
member.summary: Commits cache values and tasks to the InputAccel Server.
member.remarks: To commit values and tasks to the InputAccel Server, call or , respectively, then call Commit to send all values and tasks to the InputAccel Server.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ICache.Disabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the cache is disabled for the specified operations.
member.remarks:
Certain properties of objects are convenience wrappers around . and .. Using the Disabled property on these objects causes all calls to these properties to bypass the cache and instead routes them directly to the InputAccel Server.
The Disabled property is convenient for a small number of requests to the InputAccel Server. For larger data sets it is more efficient to update properties directly by calling to and writing values with .
The Disabled property applies to all threads accessing the Workflow.Client.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ICache.GlobalTask
member.summary: This task is used in writing values for taskless operations such as global values. This is a global task to be shared by all taskless operations, so subscribe to the OnFinish event to figure out when to update any stored objects.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IClient
member.summary: A class representing the InputAccel Client.
member.remarks: It is recommended to handle the IClient events (OnMessageCallback, OnNewTask, OnServerAdd, and so on) in a manner that does not block the thread firing the event. This allows your program to receive IClient events as soon as they occur instead of waiting until processing of the previous event has finished. An example of handling the events in a non-blocking manner is to use the ManualResetEvent class to signal another thread that processes the events.

member.summary: Logs on to an InputAccel Server.
member.param: Logon parameters object.
member.returns: TRUE if the InputAccel Server was successfully logged on to, otherwise FALSE.
member.remarks:
If FALSE is returned and is TRUE, the server connection is configured to reconnect automatically. Check for the logon error.
A module should not continue loading if LogOn returns FALSE and is FALSE. A fatal logon error has occurred and there is no possibility of reconnecting.

member.remarks: If LogOn returns FALSE and IClient.Reconnecting is TRUE, the InputAccel Server connection(s) are configured to reconnect automatically. Check for individual server connection errors. A module should not continue loading if LogOn returns FALSE and is FALSE. A fatal logon error occurrs and there is no possibility of reconnecting.

member.summary: Requests the licensing feature codes from an InputAccel Server.

remarks.para: Use this property to set the module features to be controlled by licensing. If you are developing a module that has extended capabilities for which you want users to pay an additional fee, use a feature code to control it. Only users who have a license code that enables the specified feature code are able to use the feature.
remarks.note: Feature code X enables a module to connect to multiple InputAccel Servers in a ScaleServer group. If your module is ScaleServer-compatible, you must include feature code X in your license. Feature codes Y and Z are reserved and should not be used by module developers in their modules.

member.param: A set of feature codes to request for licensing from the InputAccel Server.
member.returns: A value containing a combination of feature codes that were successfully licensed by the InputAccel Server for the currently connected module.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IFile
member.summary: Represents an InputAccel file, normal disk file, UNC path, HTTP URI, or FTP URI.
member.remarks:
InputAccel file names are represented in a URI format. All methods that take a filename as a parameter also accept a Uri format which can define an InputAccel file, normal disk file, UNC path, or a file hosted on a HTTP or FTP server.
The legacy format of an InputAccel stage file name is:
<[ClientNo]:[BatchNo]-[NodeNo]-[StageNo]
where
<: Identifies the file as an InputAccel stage file.
[ClientNo]: An ASCII string containing the hex value of the handle to client communication object (IACLIENT). This component is optional.
[BatchNo]: An ASCII string that represents the ID of the batch.
[NodeNo]: An ASCII string that represents the node number.
[StageNo]: An ASCII string that represents the stage number. The URI format of an InputAccel stage file is:
InputAccel://[ServerName]?[parametername]=[parametervalue]&[etc...]
where
[ServerName]: A string containing the name of an InputAccel Server that contains this file. For example InputAccel://deptAserver?batch=1234&node=456&stage=5.
[parametername] can be any of the following:
batch=[BatchId]
A string representing the batch ID. When this parameter is specified, "node" and "stage" must also be specified.
node=[NodeNo]: A string representing the node number. When this parameter is specified, "batch" must also be specified.
stage=[StageNo]: A string representing the stage number. When this parameter is specified, "batch" and "node" must also be specified. In addition "stage" can be an IA Value in the form step_name.file_name such as InputAccel://deptAserver?batch=1234&node=456&stage=scan.outputimage.
batchid=[BatchId]/[filename]: Use to specify a batch-related file. This cannot be combined with any other parameter. For example, InputAccel://deptAserver?batchid=1234/dictionary.txt.
batchidfile=[BatchId]: Use to specify a batch file. This cannot be combined with any other parameter. For example, InputAccel://deptAserver?batchidfile=1234.
module=[ModuleName]/[filename]: Use to specify a module-related file. This cannot be combined with any other parameter. For example, InputAccel://deptAserver?module=iascan/mymodulefile.dat.
procidfile=[ProcessId]: Use to specify a process file. This cannot be combined with any other parameter. For example, InputAccel://deptAserver?procidfile=9876.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IGlobalValueProvider
member.summary: Use to set and get global IA Values.
member.remarks: A global IA Value is a value that is not part of a batch or process.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IProtectedValueProvider
member.summary: Represents an encrypted IA Value.
member.remarks:
A protected value is accessible only by the user who created it or a user who is a member of the Administrators group. Other users will not be allowed to read or write the value. Other users attempting to read the value will receive the specified default value.
Protected values cannot be accessed using the standard IAValueGet() APIs. Attempting to access protected values using these APIs will return an error (for IAValueGetBinary) or the default value (for IAValueGetAscii and IAValueGetLong).
When a protected value is transferred between the InputAccel client and InputAccel Server, it is encrypted using Microsoft Cryptography to prevent a network sniffer from intercepting the value.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IValueProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets values from the associated InputAccel object.
member.remarks:
Value providers are tied to the objects to which they belong and to the task state, if applicable. This class supports native .NET value types, strings, StringBuilder, and one dimensional arrays of these types. Streams are also supported and can be used to get and set stage files.
Objects that implement are saved as a byte array on the InputAccel Server.
Objects must support a new() constructor. The restriction of
T Get<T>(string name, T defaultValue)
where T : new() is relaxed to support string types.
To exercise complete control over the serialization process, refer to .

member.name: F:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IValueProvider.PROPERTYNAME_LENGTH
member.summary: The general philosophy between name and key is that the function call to the IValues object is responsible for constructing the complete key.
member.remarks:
A special note regarding the formatting. Previously server took care of the formating, so this formatting needs to be maintained for string functions.
MDF type IAValueGet IAValueSet single "%.17g" atof double "%.17g" atof currency "%I64d.%04ld" CComVariant.ChangeType date CComVariant.ChangeType CComVariant.ChangeType
Strings designate sprintf usage: sprintf(returnValue, "%.17g", doubleVar)

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IProtectedValueProvider.GetProtected``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Retrieves a protected value.
member.remarks:
Protected values are only allowed as batch, step, or global values. Protected values are not allowed on a node.
GetProtected may be used to retrieve unprotected values. This usage is not recommended, as the values would still be encrypted for network transfer causing an unnecessary decrease in performance.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to retrieve.
member.param: The name of the value to retrieve.
The value returned if the value was not found.
member.returns: An object of the specified type T.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IProtectedValueProvider.SetProtected``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Stores a protected IA Value.
member.remarks: If a value has previously been set as a protected value, then the logged-on user must have permission to write to the protected value. Only the user that originally set the value and members of the Administrators group have permission to write to a protected value. If the logged-on user does not have permission to set the value, the value will not be changed, but no error will be returned.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to set.
member.param: The name of the value.
The value to store.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep.Retrigger
member.summary: Retriggers tasks from this step in a batch.
member.remarks: Retriggering tasks is useful when you need to re-process tasks from a particular step, even though those tasks were finished successfully. The Retrigger method tries to find a value that is used as a trigger for the step, and sets that value (using its current contents so it remains unchanged) for every task node. This causes the InputAccel Server on which the batch resides to queue the tasks in the step for processing.
member.returns: The number of nodes triggered.
member.exception: An attempt was made to acces an invalid InputAccel Server resource.
An error occurred while retriggering a step.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IAList`1
member.summary: IAList is a wrapper around the IAList functions. The general design is to use IAList as the factory for multiple enumerators. The individual enumerators contain the parsing code to convert string data from IAList to the specific type. IAListElement stores the list element's integer ID and string data. Exceptions to this are objects which require two passes in the list to do their construction. Currently this includes IModule.
member.remarks: To add more types to this list, create a new enumerator, override the Current property, and instantiate the new enumerator in IAList.GetEnumerator().

member.remarks:
The following lists use the parameter. List Type Object Reason IALIST_INSTANCES IABatchProcess To pass IABatchProcess object to the IAInstance constructor.
IALIST_NODALS object[2] new object[] { IALevelObject, IAInstanceObject } IALevel, IAInstance To pass IALevel and IAInstance objects to construct IADefaultValue objects. IALevelObject can be null to indicate all levels.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.Commit(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep)
member.summary: Commits this node to the InputAccel Server so that processing can occur on this node by other client modules.
member.param: The step that created this node.
member.remarks:
Call this function after creating a node. This function causes the Finish routine in the IPP to be called.
If this node is not at the trigger level, nothing will happen.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.Commit(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Commits this node to the InputAccel Server so that processing can occur on this node by other client modules.
member.param: The step that created this node.
Specifies whether the child nodes should also be committed. This is ignored if the current node is at level zero.
member.remarks:
This function is called after creating a node. This function causes the Finish routine in the IPP to be called.
If children is FALSE and this node is not at the trigger level, nothing will happen.
If children is TRUE and this node is level 1 or higher, all level 0 children are committed and then trigger level nodes are committed if the trigger level is greater than 0.
member.exception: An error occurred while committing the node.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.Move(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode)
member.summary: Moves the current node to the location directly after the specified destination node.
member.remarks: If the current node and the destination node are of the same level, the current node becomes the next peer of the destination node. If the current node is of a lower level than the destination node, the current node will become the first descendant of the destination node. If the current node is a level 0 node and the destination node is a level 2 node, the current node will become the first page in the first level 1 node within the destination (level 2) node. The level 1 node must exist prior to the move.
member.param: Destination node after which this node will be moved. Destination node's level must be greater than or equal to the current node's level.
member.exception: An error occured while moving the node.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.Move(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the node and the specified number of peer nodes to the location directly after the specified destination node.
member.remarks: If this node and the destination node are of the same level, this node becomes the next peer of the destination node. If this node is of a lower level than the destination node, this node will become the first descendant of the destination node. If this node is a level 0 node and the destination node is a level 2 node, this node will become the first page in the first level 1 node within the destination (level 2) node. The level 1 node must exist prior to the move.
member.param: Destination node, after which this node will be moved. Destination's level must be greater than or equal to this node's level.

Number of subsequent peer nodes to move, including this node. (Must be at least 1.) If greater than the number of subsequent peer nodes, only this node and the subsequent peers of this node are moved. For example, this node is the second of four pages in a level 1 node, and Count is 3 or greater, only three pages will be moved.
member.returns: Number of nodes successfully moved.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.FindFirstTaskedChild(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep)
member.summary: Finds the first child node that contains a task to process.
member.param: The step where the child node resides.
member.remarks: Call this method recursively to find the first node that has a task waiting to be processed. Use this method if you need to process nodes in the order they are found in the tree. (Normally, the InputAccel Server does not guarantee that tasks are scheduled in the order the nodes are arranged in the tree.) After a task has been found, your module can set values for the task by using the SetValue...() methods, and can operate on the node as if it had a task. However, this method does not actually send the task to the module, and no prefetching of tasks occurs. Your module can clear the task by calling TaskClear. If you clear the task, you can call FindFirstTaskedChild again to find the next node.
member.returns: The first node with a task to process.

member.summary: Fires the Retrigger event in the IPP for this node.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.TaskClear(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep,System.Int32)
member.summary: Finishes a task that was manually invoked.
member.param: Status to send to the InputAccel Server. If set to IA_SUCCESS, the step's Finish routine is called; otherwise, the Finish routine is not called.
The step that received the task.
member.remarks: Use this method to finish a task (and call its Finish routine) instead of calling TaskFinish when the task was not received in the normal way (that is, by handling new task events). For example, you would need to use the TaskClear() method when you got a task to process by calling the FindFirstTaskedChild() method and invoked the task by calling the TaskPrepare() method.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.TaskPrepare(Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IStep)
member.summary: Invokes the IPP Prepare routine for the specified step.
member.param: The step receiving the task.
member.remarks: This method is generally used in conjunction with FindFirstTaskedChild() and TaskClear(). When FindFirstTaskChild() is used to get a task to process (rather than the standard way of handling new task events), the Prepare routine for the node/step is not executed. Calling TaskPrepare() causes the Prepare event to be executed for the node. When the task completes, call TaskClear() to finish the task and invoke its Finish routine.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.INode.GetFormattedValue(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Gets a formatted node value.
member.param:
Format string which may contain any printable ASCII characters. If the parameter contains an embedded @xxx, the string is evaluated as explained in the following tables.
ValueDescriptionExample
@x
Gets the index of the node at the specified xth level, within the level x+1.
Format=@2.@1.@0 - returns "1.3.24" | Gets a string value that has a Box.Folder.Page format. (The index of the level 2 node, followed by the level 1 node, followed by the level 0 node.)
@xy
If x<y, gets the index of the node at the specified xth level within the specified level y.
Format=Page @07 - returns "Page 32" | Gets the word "Page" followed by the index of the current node, beginning with the first node in the tree (the level 0 node within the level 7 node). If you change @07 to @01, then page numbering will reset to 1 each time a new folder (level 1 node) is encountered.
@xy
If x>y, gets the number of the y level children of x, where x must be the current level.
Format=Pagecount: @10 - returns "Pagecount: 47" | Gets the word "Pagecount:" followed by the number of level 0 nodes (pages, in this example) wihin the current level 1 node.
@n
Gets the hexadecimal node number.
Format=@n - returns "B9" | Gets the unique node number in hexadecimal. This is different than a node index, which is a sequential number and not necessarily unique. Consider using "0x@n to prepend "0x" to indicate hexadecimal.
@N
Gets the decimal node number.
Format=@N - returns "185" | Gets the unique node number in decimal. This is different than a node index, which is a sequential number an not necessarily unique.
@l (lower case L)
Internal use only. Gets the number of pixcache locks on the current node.
Format=@l - returns "3" | A value of "-" means that the node is not in pixcache.
@L
Internal use only. Gets the total number of locks in the pixcache.
Format=@L - returns "27"
TreeVersion
Gets the local InputAccel version number for the tree, used internally to keep the tree synchronized and up-to-date. Whenever the tree changes, its version number is incremented. Since this format string is not cached, it may not be the same as the special value #(TreeVersion), which is the cached version number.
Format=TreeVersion - returns "56"
@(SpecialValue)
Gets a special string IA Value.
See the following Special Value list.
@[SpecialValue]
Gets a special string IA Value. If no value is found, search previous nodes until the value is found.
See the following Special Value list.
Special ValueDescriptionExample
BatchName
The name of the batch that owns the current node.
Format=@(BatchName) - returns "MyBatch"
Description
The description string of the batch that owns the current node.
Format=@(Description) - returns "A batch I created for capturing my personal documents"
ProcessName
The name of the process from which the batch that owns the current node was created.
Format=@(ProcessName) - returns "Image 1 - Scan + Export Images"
TreeVersion
The cached InputAccel Server version number for the tree, used interally to keep the tree synchronized and up-to-date. Whenever the tree changes, its version number is incremented. Since this special value is cached, it may not be the same as the format string "TreeVersion", which is the local version number.
Format=@(ProcessName) - returns "Image 1 - Scan + Export Images"
Priority
The priority of the batch that owns the current node.
Format=@(Priority) - returns "50"
$step=inst/Priority
The priority of the specified step that is declared in the batch that owns the current node. Although the Administration Console and ScanPlus module set priority only of entire batches, the API supports setting each step to a different priority to optimize overall performance.
Format=@($step=ocr/Priority) - returns "10"

A bit field containing the flag listed below.
ValueDescription
1
Enclose the return value in quotes.
A default value to return if the specified value cannot be found.
member.returns: The requested node values, or the string specified in the Default parameter if no value is found.
member.exception: An error occured while working with an INode object.

member.remarks: This member does not indicate whether a file is currently readable. Instead, it indicates that the implementation of this interface supports reading. This implementation supports reading of files, so this interface always returns TRUE.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IAStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Returns TRUE: the file is always seekable.
member.remarks: This member does not indicate whether a file is currently seekable. Instead, it indicates that the implementation of this interface supports seeking for the file. This implementation supports seeking of files, so this interface always returns TRUE.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IAStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Returns TRUE: the file is always writable.
member.remarks: This member does not indicate whether a file is currently writable. Instead, it indicates that the implementation of this interface supports writing. This implementation supports writing of files, so this interface always returns TRUE.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IAStream.Length
member.summary: Returns the length of the file in bytes.

member.name: P:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.IAStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the byte offset from current location of the file pointer or sets byte offset from the beginning of the file.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.TaskType
member.summary: Represents the values for a task. The Client.NET layer is limiting the concept of a task to just a "Real" task received from the InputAccel Server. "Manual" tasks break that concept a little in that they are tied to a particular batch on a particular InputAccel Server, so therefore they are psuedo real tasks. "Fake" tasks, which are simply value caches (as are all the other types of caches), are completely hidden from the user of Client.NET.

member.name: T:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ITask
member.summary: Represents an InputAccel task.
member.remarks:
This gets passed to the module during the event.
ITask objects become invalid when the InputAccel Server connection is lost, when the batch that the task came from is deleted, or when the or methods are called.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ITree.SetTreeCallbacks(System.Boolean,Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.TreeEventReason)
member.summary: Sets or clears tree-related callbacks.
member.param: Set (true) or clear (false) the callbacks.
member.remarks: Set these callbacks before deleting the batch or adding/moving/deleting a node.

member.name: M:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ITree.OldLocalTreeFunction(System.Void*,Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.TreeEventReason)
member.summary: Callback function that is used whenever an operation is done on an old tree.
member.param: The tree in which the operation is made
member.returns: The default return value is IA_ERR_OLDLOCALTREE to indicate that the operation is canceled.
member.remarks: Client32 will use a callback function to handle a warning to the user that an operation is being performed on an old tree. This could happen if two module instances are working on the same tree and one deletes a node then the other deletes another node. The tree in the second module instance does not know about the operation performed by the first instance.

member.summary: OnRemoveSavedLock is fired when a saved Modify lock prevents a tree operation from occurring. The consumer of OnRemoveSavedLock may choose to remove the saved lock.

member.name: E:Emc.InputAccel.Workflow.Client.ITree.OnLockWait
member.summary: Occurs when an operation requires a lock but is blocked by a lock from a different module. The consumer of OnLockWait can continue or cancel the wait.
member.remarks: If this event is not handled, the wait is canceled by default.
